title: Using consecrated wood for cooking
vignette: A caretaker takes central complex wood to bake his bread at home.

options.text: He must repay with an added fifth for misuse.
No penalty because it was for sustenance.

title: Accidental benefit from sacred funds
vignette: Coins designated for the central complex fall into a purse used for shopping.

options.text: Replace the amount plus a fifth once noticed.
Only repay the principal value.

title: Misused offering then returned
vignette: An animal designated for sacrifice was ridden briefly before being brought to the main platform.

options.text: The ride constitutes meilah requiring compensation.
Since it was unharmed, no additional payment.

title: Clothing made from sacred fabric
vignette: Tailors fashioned garments from leftover central complex cloth by mistake.

options.text: They must reimburse the central complex with a surcharge.
Return the clothing without extra cost.

title: Using sanctified animal for labor
vignette: A farmer plows with his tithed ox forgetting it was holy.

options.text: He owes meilah payment.
No penalty if accidental and brief.

title: Public inadvertently enjoys sacred property
vignette: central complex wine is distributed mistakenly at a town feast.

options.text: Community collectively repays the value plus a fifth.
Waive repayment since it benefited many.

title: Dedication revoked unknowingly
vignette: A donor cancels his dedication privately yet officials are unaware and use the item.

options.text: No meilah since it was no longer sacred.
Officials must repay because they believed it sacred.

title: Sacred coin used to pay wages
vignette: A treasurer mistakenly pays workers with central complex funds.

options.text: Workers return the coins and receive regular payment.
Let them keep the coins; treat it as central complex expense.

title: Lost track of sanctified materials
vignette: Wood donated for the main platform gets mixed with ordinary logs.

options.text: Treat the entire pile as sacred.
Estimate and set aside an equivalent portion.

title: Benefit after redemption payment
vignette: Someone redeems a holy vessel by paying its value, then uses it at home.

options.text: Permitted once properly redeemed.
Still disrespectful to use holy items.

title: Shared responsibility for misuse
vignette: Several partners profit from selling a sacred animal.

options.text: Each pays according to his share.
Only the one initiating sale pays.

title: Ignorance of an item's sanctity
vignette: A buyer purchases central complex goods unaware of their status.

options.text: Once informed he must repay with a fifth.
He is exempt since he lacked intent.

title: Benefit after partial payment
vignette: A woman begins repayment for misuse but enjoys the item before completing payment.

options.text: Further use is still prohibited until fully paid.
Partial payment allows continued use.

title: Misuse by central complex officials
vignette: Clerks take home small amounts of sacred incense as a perk.

options.text: They must reimburse and face discipline.
Perks are acceptable compensation.

title: Unintentional meilah discovered late
vignette: Years after using a sacred bowl, someone learns it was never deconsecrated.

options.text: Pay meilah even years later.
Too lateâ€”statute of limitations should apply.
